title: List 2-distance $$\varDelta +3$$ -coloring of planar graphs without 4,5-cycles
abstract: Let $$\chi _2(G)$$ and $$\chi _2^l(G)$$ be the 2-distance chromatic number and list 2-distance chromatic number of a graph G, respectively. Wegner conjectured that for each planar graph G with maximum degree $$\varDelta $$ at least 4, $$\chi _2(G)\le \varDelta +5$$ if $$4\le \varDelta \le 7$$ , and $$\chi _2(G)\le \lfloor \frac{3\varDelta }{2}\rfloor +1$$ if $$\varDelta \ge 8$$ . Let G be a planar graph without 4,5-cycles. We show that if $$\varDelta \ge 26$$ , then $$\chi _2^l(G)\le \varDelta +3$$ . There exist planar graphs G with girth $$g(G)=6$$ such that $$\chi _2^l(G)=\varDelta +2$$ for arbitrarily large $$\varDelta $$ . In addition, we also discuss the list L(2, 1)-labeling number of G, and prove that $$\lambda _l(G)\le \varDelta +8$$ for $$\varDelta \ge 27$$ .
